titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2866) to provide for the sound management and protection of Redwood forest areas in Humboldt County, California, by adding certain lands and waters to the Six Rivers National Forest and by including a portion of such lands in the national wilderness preservation system.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-732, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2866 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Points of order against provisions of the bill for failure to comply with clause 5(a) of rule XXI shall be waived. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. Except as provided ins sec. 2 of this resolution, no amendment shall be in order except those printed in the report accompanying this resolution, to be offered in the order and manner specified. All points of order against the amendments shall be waived. Sec. 2 makes it in order for the Chairman of the Committee on Agriculture to offer amendments en bloc consisting of amendments printed in the report or germane modifications of any such amendment. Amendments en bloc shall be debatable for 10 minutes, shall not be subject to amendment, nor subje...

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 220.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 245 - 175 (Roll no. 429).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 246 - 174 (Roll no. 430).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/20/1994--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2866 (California national forest lands).
